intro: Lastrea fairbankii, commonly known as the Fairbank's lastrea, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
